results.authors: By Yoolim Lee and Sangmi Cha
results.headline: Samsung Stock Gains as Nvidia Works to Certify Its HBM Chips
results.summary: Samsung Electronics Co. shares rose after Nvidia Corp. said it is working to certify the company’s high-bandwidth memory chips, a critical step that would allow the Korean company to capitalize on booming demand for AI technologies.

results.headline: Intel to Sell 49% of Irish Venture to Apollo for $11 Billion
results.summary: Intel Corp. agreed to sell a stake in a venture that controls a plant in Ireland to Apollo Global Management Inc. for $11 billion, helping bring in more external funding for a massive expansion of its factory network.

results.headline: CrowdStrike’s Steep Valuation Makes It Outlier in Software Space
results.summary: CrowdStrike Holdings Inc. investors face a precarious setup heading into the cybersecurity company’s next earnings report as its sky-high valuation faces off with rapidly souring sentiment for software stocks.

results.headline: Intel CEO Takes Aim at Nvidia in Fight for AI Chip Dominance
results.summary: Intel Corp. Chief Executive Officer Pat Gelsinger took the stage at the Computex show in Taiwan to talk about new products he expects will help turn back the tide of share losses to peers, including AI leader Nvidia Corp.

results.authors: By Stefan Nicola and Monica Raymunt
results.headline: Slapping Tariffs on China Will Delay Green Shift, Ex-VW CEO Says
results.summary: An escalating trade spat between China and the West would fuel inflation and delay the transition to a cleaner economy, said former Volkswagen AG Chief Executive Officer Herbert Diess.

results.authors: By Vlad Savov and Jane Lanhee Lee
results.headline: Nvidia CEO Says Working to Certify Samsung’s AI Memory Chips
results.summary: Nvidia Corp. is still working on the certification process for Samsung Electronics Co.’s high-bandwidth memory chips, a final required step before the Korean company can begin supplying a component essential to training AI platforms.

results.headline: TSMC’s New Chairman Affirms Hopes of AI-Fueled 2024 Recovery
results.summary: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co.’s C.C. Wei, who on Tuesday became the first person to hold the dual roles of chairman and chief executive officer in years, reaffirmed expectations for AI development to drive a 2024 industry recovery.

results.headline: South Korea’s Inflation Cools Further as Policy Pivot Hopes Rise
results.summary: South Korea’s inflation eased more than expected in May, nudging the central bank an inch closer to joining global peers embarking on a path to a policy easing.

results.authors: By Vlad Savov, Jane Lanhee Lee, and Takashi Mochizuki
results.headline: Jensen Huang Computex Keynote: Nvidia Reveals New AI Software and Services
results.summary: Nvidia Corp. and Advanced Micro Devices Inc.’s chiefs showcased new generations of the chips powering the global boom in AI development, deepening a rivalry that’s shaping the future of artificial intelligence design and adoption.

results.headline: A Billion-Dollar Divorce Could Resolve the 'Korea Discount'
results.summary: The stubborn so-called “Korea Discount” can only be resolved with a corporate K-drama.
